intro: Cracca bivonea, commonly known as the narrowleaf cracca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by seed heads that are dispersed by the wind. Cracca bivonea is often used in herbal medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
